column2: As part of Sodexo transformation program, Sodexo has decided to introduce an ERP system to standardize the way of working throughout the organization.     As part of the wider Sodexo transformation program, Supply Management will be re-positioned as strategic function to influence strategies, develop profitable offers and boost sales.     To support this transformation, Supply Management function has commenced a Data and System Transformation Program with the objective to deliver best in class business processes and supporting tools to the team's delivering activity across our supply chain.      We want to transform the data and technical capability available to our Supply Management function to enable them to deliver a world class function.     This role aims at simplifying supply management processes for operations through a lean approach. This is a part of the current workstream on P2P process under the shared responsibility of finance and supply management.     The scope, like the ERP, is global, with a focus for this role on Country / APMEA On-site services.       Root cause analysis and improvements:       An As-Is analysis of the current situation aiming at identifying symptoms and root causes is expected. Root causes and issues can be global, regional, or specific to a country as today processes vary a lot from country to country. The root causes creating most issues will need to be identified using metrics and status shared and agreed.     Once the initial root cause analysis done, recommended actions will need to be drafted, agreed, and implemented measurement of progress is expected using KPIs to be defined. Such activities will need to be embedded into existing projects, initiatives or action plan on system, people, data or processes in order to avoid any siloed work.       Process design       The role will work closely with supply and operations to understand current processes in countries / regions to identify fit gaps, develop an action plan together with the BPO how to transform the way of working and support to implement and train the countries / regions according the global Supply Management processes.     An iterative approach by testing the efficiency of changes is expected to keep improving the recommendations. The approach is lean processes over comprehensive documentation. Also, existing work on P2P processes mapping done as part of the ERP implementation program should be leveraged.     Process implementation and change     Support the communication and activities with countries & global teams.      Conduct alignment workshops and support countries in the formalization of plans.     Train Local Business Process Owners / key users on target processes     Build a network of process experts to embark a maximum of users / countries. Through periodic touch points facilitate and speed-up the sharing and the implementation of best practices.      She / He will also feed the development of identifying gaps in the current IS&T systems along with the Supply Management BPOs.      Review and approve change requests and country localizations.      Enforce the implementation of standard practices where gaps are identified and escalate significant issues to the Group Process Governance Committee        Continuous improvement       Measure / Benchmark Process Performance Indicators (sizing, productivity, compliance, cycle time, cost) and enablers for improvement (simplification, automation, optimization, value added)       Context and main issues       Supply Management has initiated a transformation which will lead to more automation and simplification. A focus on operational needs and experience is needed which is why a dedicated role has been created.      Collaborate with key stakeholders across country, regional and global function and across departments (finance, supply, IS&T, operations) to understand the situation, requirements and translate them into actionable activities.     Challenge status quo with aim of simplification, standardization aligned with the global processes & leveraging existing investment in P2P processes.     Leverage technology and ERP to address issues and bring significant improvements to the SM function and the operations.       Main assignments       Understanding the future ways of working to enable business change and new system implementation.     Select & on-board a team to lead a short-term study to build a root cause analysis for countries. Leveraging existing inputs from IS&T, supply and finance.      Map root cause, pain points and country specificities \xe2\x80\x93 identify commonalities.     Draft and propose a plan of concrete actions to improve current process on below topics.     Prioritize Gaps and Develop Your Action Plan in alignment with the APMEA BPO.     Communicates project implementation options that affect cost, schedule, quality and risk to stakeholders,      Support the implementation of missing and needed fields in systems.     Catalog creation process implementation to support Better Tomorrow Reporting automation.     Prioritize the workplan per country / region.     Lead the communication and engagement strategy, especially with IS&T and the integrator.     Take a lead role in the UAT testing of any change in systems and ensuring that requirements are met.     continuous update the Business Analyst to keep processes (changes) in ARIS up to date.     When delivering agile projects, produce User Stories if required on behalf of the Product Owner.       Accountabilities       Defines KPIs to monitor progress and track benefits, with regular status updates provided to project stakeholders and executive management team as per the program governance plan.      End to end P2P process improved inc. catalogue and compliance.     Automation of CSR reporting improved       Experience:       Ideally have worked as consultant in Supply Management for 5+ years. ( Food business preferred)     Bachelors degree in engineering with good understanding of computer system.     Experience in lean management and/or six sigmaKnowledge of operational processes.     Strong knowledge of procure to pay process / Catalogue Management     Process driven orientation and experience of working with cross functional teams and global stakeholders.     Experience in supporting change at a senior management level with internal and external stakeholders as well as suppliers.      Project Management experience is a plus.     Fluency in English required. column2: As part of Sodexo transformation program, Sodexo has decided to introduce an ERP system to standardize the way of working throughout the organization.     As part of the wider Sodexo transformation program, Supply Management will be re-positioned as strategic function to influence strategies, develop profitable offers and boost sales.     To support this transformation, Supply Management function has commenced a Data and System Transformation Program with the objective to deliver best in class business processes and supporting tools to the team's delivering activity across our supply chain.      We want to transform the data and technical capability available to our Supply Management function to enable them to deliver a world class function.     This role aims at simplifying supply management processes for operations through a lean approach. This is a part of the current workstream on P2P process under the shared responsibility of finance and supply management.     The scope, like the ERP, is global, with a focus for this role on Country / APMEA On-site services.       Root cause analysis and improvements:       An As-Is analysis of the current situation aiming at identifying symptoms and root causes is expected. Root causes and issues can be global, regional, or specific to a country as today processes vary a lot from country to country. The root causes creating most issues will need to be identified using metrics and status shared and agreed.     Once the initial root cause analysis done, recommended actions will need to be drafted, agreed, and implemented measurement of progress is expected using KPIs to be defined. Such activities will need to be embedded into existing projects, initiatives or action plan on system, people, data or processes in order to avoid any siloed work.       Process design       The role will work closely with supply and operations to understand current processes in countries / regions to identify fit gaps, develop an action plan together with the BPO how to transform the way of working and support to implement and train the countries / regions according the global Supply Management processes.     An iterative approach by testing the efficiency of changes is expected to keep improving the recommendations. The approach is lean processes over comprehensive documentation. Also, existing work on P2P processes mapping done as part of the ERP implementation program should be leveraged.     Process implementation and change     Support the communication and activities with countries & global teams.      Conduct alignment workshops and support countries in the formalization of plans.     Train Local Business Process Owners / key users on target processes     Build a network of process experts to embark a maximum of users / countries. Through periodic touch points facilitate and speed-up the sharing and the implementation of best practices.      She / He will also feed the development of identifying gaps in the current IS&T systems along with the Supply Management BPOs.      Review and approve change requests and country localizations.      Enforce the implementation of standard practices where gaps are identified and escalate significant issues to the Group Process Governance Committee        Continuous improvement       Measure / Benchmark Process Performance Indicators (sizing, productivity, compliance, cycle time, cost) and enablers for improvement (simplification, automation, optimization, value added)       Context and main issues       Supply Management has initiated a transformation which will lead to more automation and simplification. A focus on operational needs and experience is needed which is why a dedicated role has been created.      Collaborate with key stakeholders across country, regional and global function and across departments (finance, supply, IS&T, operations) to understand the situation, requirements and translate them into actionable activities.     Challenge status quo with aim of simplification, standardization aligned with the global processes & leveraging existing investment in P2P processes.     Leverage technology and ERP to address issues and bring significant improvements to the SM function and the operations.       Main assignments       Understanding the future ways of working to enable business change and new system implementation.     Select & on-board a team to lead a short-term study to build a root cause analysis for countries. Leveraging existing inputs from IS&T, supply and finance.      Map root cause, pain points and country specificities \xe2\x80\x93 identify commonalities.     Draft and propose a plan of concrete actions to improve current process on below topics.     Prioritize Gaps and Develop Your Action Plan in alignment with the APMEA BPO.     Communicates project implementation options that affect cost, schedule, quality and risk to stakeholders,      Support the implementation of missing and needed fields in systems.     Catalog creation process implementation to support Better Tomorrow Reporting automation.     Prioritize the workplan per country / region.     Lead the communication and engagement strategy, especially with IS&T and the integrator.     Take a lead role in the UAT testing of any change in systems and ensuring that requirements are met.     continuous update the Business Analyst to keep processes (changes) in ARIS up to date.     When delivering agile projects, produce User Stories if required on behalf of the Product Owner.       Accountabilities       Defines KPIs to monitor progress and track benefits, with regular status updates provided to project stakeholders and executive management team as per the program governance plan.      End to end P2P process improved inc. catalogue and compliance.     Automation of CSR reporting improved       Experience:       Ideally have worked as consultant in Supply Management for 5+ years. ( Food business preferred)     Bachelors degree in engineering with good understanding of computer system.     Experience in lean management and/or six sigmaKnowledge of operational processes.     Strong knowledge of procure to pay process / Catalogue Management     Process driven orientation and experience of working with cross functional teams and global stakeholders.     Experience in supporting change at a senior management level with internal and external stakeholders as well as suppliers.      Project Management experience is a plus.     Fluency in English required.       Skills:       Team Player     Communicator and Negotiator     Planning (workplan, resources) and tracking (indicators, actions)     Problem solving, hands-on.     disciplined and accountable     Verbal Communication     Flexibility to travel       Competencies       Results Oriented     Leadership & People Management     Collaborates     Adaptability & Flexibility     Accountability     Continuous Improvement     Communicates effectively     Results Oriented
